description: It's Debatable is an elegant, modern form of debate which involves a team of students working to effectively convince a judge that their side of a resolution is more valid. So here we are with an event to give you a chance to show your strong and effective communication skills. To participate in this event a team of 2 members (compulsory) and ability to assert dominance with facts is required.
rules: Detailed Rules can be viewed here
No. of rounds:2 -per day 1 round
No. of hours and days required:2 days and per day 2-3 hours
There will be two teams, each consisting of two speakers.
The first speaker for the affirmative side begins. Then, the first speaker for the negative side responds. In this way, the speakers for both sides speak in turn.

Each speaker has a maximum time of one minute. The judge will check the time carefully. He/ she gives a sign when the speaker has 10 seconds to go, and after speaking time is over, the speaker may finish his/her sentence and must then stop. Spare time may not be transferred to another speaker.Interrupting a speaker is forbidden.
Controversial topics should be avoided
Speakers are accepted to use appropriate language. On use of inappropriate language the judges have the authority to disqualify the team
There will be a time limit of 7 mins for each topic so one of the team must conclude so as to complete the debate in the given time limit.
The audience must not participate in the debate.
After the debate, the audience has 3 minutes to share their impressions and opinions in which they can ask questions which are related to any of the members of the teams.
The witness must answer the questions from the audience without consulting his/her members.
The judge will base his/her decision entirely on the material presented, without regard for other material which he may happen to possess and declare the result.

tagLine: Write Code’s that computer can digest
description: Codigo is a technical event wherein the participants have to write programs/codes as solutions for the problem statements provided to them within the time provided.There is no restriction of any programming language. It is a solo event where the participants will be tested on their competitive programming skills,ability to understand problem statements and give the appropriate solution which should be able to qualify test cases provided. Students through this event will be able to understand their problem solving abilities in programming and will be able to improve their effective thinking capacity.
rules: Platform: Hackerrank
Round 1: Fastest coder First Questions: 9 questions with easy logical questions (may vary) Time: 1:30hr
Round 2: Challenge yourself Questions: 6 questions with all types of difficulties (may vary) Time: 1:30 hr.
Ranks will be decided from hackerrank leaderboard and after plagiarism checking.
Top 50% (may vary) from hackerrank leaderboard will be qualified for round 2.
Contest will be held on Hackerrank.
Plagiarism detectors will detect solutions, if found similar codes or copied from other sites
This is a two day event.
We will provide you with a contest link on registered email 2 days prior to contest.
Last decision will be made by the event organizers.

tagLine: Test your Aptitude skills with us!!
description: The event Brain Apti is a way for students to assess a candidate’s abilities through a variety of different testing formats. This includes problem-solving, prioritization, and numerical skills, amongst other things. The psychometric tests are multiple-choice and there is only ever one correct answer, your score is then marked and your level is compared against other  candidates who have taken the same test as you.
rules: Participants must follow given timing , as the rounds will start sharp on time.

tagLine: When you see a good move, look for a better one.
description: The Chess Tournamate will be open to all the students and faculty from all engineering colleges.
rules: Day 1 - Swiss Tournament of 5 rounds (5 min + 3 sec Increment)
Day 2 - Single elimination for top 16 from the previous day (10 min + 0 sec Increment)
Day 3 - Semifinals and Finals match + Bronze match (15 min + 10 sec Increment)
Participants will have to join the Anantya21 team on Lichess for the Day 1 tournament. Link - https://lichess.org/team/anantya21.
Link and password for joining the Day 1 Swiss Tournament will be provided to the registered participants via email. DO NOT share this information with anyone.
Top 16 from Day 1 Swiss tournament will be selected for the knockouts.
Organizers have the rights to disqualify players suspected of breaching the fair play policy of Lichess.org.
Seeding for the Day 2 brackets will be based on the rankings of Day 1.

Knockouts from day 2 will be in a format of ‘Best of 3’. Tie breaks will be done by an armageddon game where white will have 5 minutes and black will have 4 minutes. Black will be eliminated if white wins the game and white will be eliminated if black wins the game or even if it ends in a tie.

Participants will have to play from a Desktop/ Laptop or any other device which will enable you to share your video and screen at the same time on discord. It is compulsory for all participants in the knockouts.
It is players’ responsibility to be available for the matches on specified times.

tagLine: Sink into the world of games.
description: Team type(Solo/Group): Group Group size (if any): 5
rules: No. of rounds: 1 Group vs 1 group, Knockout matches
No. of hours and days required: 45 minutes for one match
The mode of the tournament will be in the form of STANDARD.
Each team will get at least 1 or maybe more matches depending on the number of   participant teams.
Details regarding maps won’t be displayed earlier, it will be a random choice.
It will be 5 Vs 5 format i.e each team will consist of 5 players.
Any technical issues from the participant side will not be entertained.
Participants have to ensure proper internet connection from their side.
Rematch will be held only if the difficulty is from the organizers side.

tagLine: Our gear is packed and ready to go
description: Team type(Solo/Group): Group Group size (if any): 4
rules: No. of rounds: 1 Group vs 1 group, Knockout matches
No. of hours and days required: 15-20 minutes for one match
The mode of the tournament will be in the form of team death matches.
Each team will get at least 1 or maybe more matches depending on the number of participant teams
Details regarding maps won’t be displayed earlier, it will be a random choice.
It will be 4 Vs 4 format i.e each team will consist of 4 players.
Any technical issues from the participant side will not be entertained.
Participants have to ensure proper internet connection from their side.
Rematch will be held only if the difficulty is from the organizers side.

tagLine: Have video skills and no project?
description: Team type(Solo/Group): Group Group size (if any): NA
rules: No. of rounds: 1
No. of hours and days required: 3 Days
The two themes are Loneliness and Action. The participant has to choose one among the two.
The participant will be provided with music and footage(worth 20 minutes) on a Google Drive folder.
The final cut must be between 30 to 90 seconds.
Using audio or video from outside will lead to disqualification.
Upon confirmation of your registration, you will be added to a WhatsApp group where you will receive updates and a link to upload your final cut.

tagLine: Use your cameras to click something other than assignments
description: Great photography is about depth of feeling, not depth of field. “Life is like a camera. Just focus on what's important and capture the good times, develop from the negatives and if things don't work out, just take another shot.” The event ‘Snapshot Redefined’ is the perfect platform for you to display your stunning photographs. We categorised this event into two parts : Theme-based photography and Dish Décor .
rules:
There are two categories under Snapshot redefined : Theme based photography and Dish Décor. Entries, Prizes, judgement criteria will be separate for both categories.
Participants are allowed to send entries for both of the categories.A form link will be shared with you via mail for submission.

Category 1 : Theme based photography:

Theme 1: Emotion Depicts : In the above theme, participants should click a picture according to their perspective and vision. Tell your feelings in the description of the image.Inshort, clicked the Images that tell the entire story.
Theme 2: Architecture Photography :The way a city looks can speak volumes about the people in it. It can convey culture, class, and status. Architecture can tell stories about current civilizations, the way that it was before, or in some cases, the way it'll be in the future. You can show an individual detail, a whole building or an entire cityscape through your photograph and tell a story about the person/people living there. Tagline - Civilization on a canvas.

Category 2: Dish Décor : A delicious meal appeals to more of your senses than just smell and taste. It must also appeal to the eye. To encourage creativity and culinary excellence, the participants would have to arrange, garnish and style a dish. The theme is “Your take on Your Meal”. Jazz up your meal in your own unique way, be it the everyday staple or a 5 course menu, make it exciting, adorn it.To achieve a well-plated dish, you must pay attention to the details i.e. the colors, the textures and how everything comes together.

Rules for Theme based photography:
Photos should be clicked after the announcement of the event. For the above theme-based photography, there should be a short description / express your feelings for that particular picture. Each picture should be in .jpg/.jpeg/.png format. Description of the photo should be given separately in the submission form. The photograph must be original and no watermark of any kind should be on the photograph. The timestamp is mandatory for all pictures. The photograph must be of the highest resolution possible. Color grading and correction is allowed. In Case We found Copyright from some resource, those participants will be Disqualified. The name should be in the format NameOfParticipant.jpg. The decision of the organizers will be final.

Rules for Dish Décor:
Use edible ingredients only, for decoration and plating. Maximum 3 images can be submitted. Multiple shots can be collaged and submitted as one image. Format of photos should be .jpg or .png. Color grading is allowed. The name should be in the format NameOfParticipant.jpg Every Image will go through a plagiarism check, if found participants will be Disqualified. The decision of the organizers will be final.

description: Participants will have to choose one emotion from the list below. And try to portray the emotion through any of the art forms or performing art. One can use skills like dancing, singing, acting, painting, photography, sketching or something that justifies the emotion. Submit video or photo accordingly. Emotions : Love, Fear, Happiness, Admiration, Excitement, Courage.Team type(Solo/Group): Solo Group size (if any): NA
rules: No. of rounds: 1
Choose only one emotion.
Submission link will be provided on event day.
The video of performing art should not take more than 2 min.
In case we found copyright from some resource, those students will be disqualified.
Judging Criteria: The ability to convey the selected emotion appropriately through the art form

description: Hackathon is the technical event wherein participants have to implement their innovative ideas and develop their projects within stipulated time. This event is designed exclusively for all the students who want to showcase their amazing ideas and projects. The project must be based on any Computer Science relevant technologies.(eg. Web App , Android App , Graphics Project , IoT , ML models, etc). There will be two rounds. In the first round participants have to submit their idea with a project report or presentation. In the final round selected teams will have to implement their ideas in a given amount of time followed by a final presentation. Evaluation will also be done in specified time intervals similar to normal offline hackathons. Team type(Solo/Group): Group Group size (if any): max 4
rules: No. of rounds: 2
Judging Criteria: Evaluation Rounds conducted during online hackathon
Deadlines should be followed strictly.
Standard Report Format provided should be strictly followed.
All the intermediate evaluation processes during 24 hrs Online
Hackathon should be followed.
All the group members should be present during the final online presentation.
The results and winners identified by judges will be final and non-negotiable under any conditions.

description: Perplexo is an event where you get to test your knowledge in the wide domain of the Internet and Technology. It is an event  consisting of a series of questions, a trail of hints followed by a sequence of surprisingly tricking answers along with a live ranking leaderboard. We return again with greater difficulty, tougher ciphers and deeper trails. You have to be more attentive, cautious and aware than at any time you are. Push your limits, bend the rules and crack the code. Last year only a few were able to reach level 9, but none completed the challenge. Do you have what it takes to beat perplexo in its own game? Inspect things clearly to know more about us We have been watching you We are Perplexo We pick the best.
rules: No. of rounds: 2
Group size : 2 max

description: In the first round, the participants will be given a code, and they have to find out the problem statement of that code by analyzing and observing it, so basically, they will have to retrace back to the problem statement of the code given to them. The second round will be a little challenging in which the participants will have to find out the errors/ missing lines etc. in the given piece of code.
rules: Event is strictly solo
Participants will be gathered in a meet and will be informed about the platform and also demo would be provided.

Round 1 consists of some questions. Participants have to guess the problem statement according to the given code and have to mention what the output 0 and 1 indicates. Eg. 0 means even and 1 means odd

Round 2: There would be two types of questions:
Type 1:Fix the code, that is debug it
Type 2: Find the missing lines.
Marks would be given only if the code has been properly fixed that is running properly, else zero marks would be given.
Judging Criteria: Evaluation based on the solution submitted by the participant.
Tab/ Window switching is strictly forbidden.

description: Do you love quizzes and fun word-games? Would you love to test out your knowledge-pedia? Then this is the place for you! The Bamboozled team has brought together 3 rounds of entertaining quizzes consisting of interesting trivia questions, a quick word racer, and an ultimate rapid fire round.
rules:
Round 1: Timed Quiz of 10 questions (Platform: Kahoot and GMeet) The participants will log on to Kahoot.it and ente the provided pin to play the game. The round will consist of multiple choice general knowledge questions from all categories.
Round 2: (Surprise) The participants will have to download the Houseparty app on their phones or play online on the laptop. The round will consist of alphabetical letters and the participants will have to make the maximum number of possible words in order to score more points.
Round 3: Rapid Fire (Platform: GMeet) The participants will have to answer as many questions as possible within the stipulated time of 1 minute. No options will be provided in this round. The results will be calculated by the monitoring team.
It will be a solo game.
(You will be playing for Yourself, and the prizes will be sent to you alone, no need to share your prize anymore)
Platforms which will be used are Kahoot and Google Meet.
It is desirable to maintain a good Internet connection.
Cheating and manipulation will not be entertained.
It would be great if you have two devices (not a compulsion).

Kahoot nickname format : Firstname Lastname (it will make it easier for us to send prizes to the actual winners, so in order to protect yourself from any misplacement of your prizes, we recommend you to use your names in above given format)

tagLine: Binge too much? Reel knowledge just got real with this fun movie quiz!
description: “Reel-istic Spree” is a quiz competition completely based on movies and webseries  Team type(Solo/Group): Solo Group size (if any): NA
rules: No. of rounds: 3
No. of hours and days required: 1 hours, 3 day
1st round : 45 minutes 2nd Round : 45 minutes 3rd round : 90 minutes
Judging Criteria: Kahoot ranks after each round.
Round 1 : Questions will be tricky, name if movie or series to be guessed.
Round 2 : Questions will be in the form of memes or emojis.
Round 3 : A silent video will be played for each question. The name of the movie/series, the scene and dialogue is to be guessed.
Decisions made by organizers will be final.

tagLine: Strategy and ideas is about stretching limited resources to fit ambitious aspirations
description: The event would be conducted on gMeet. The maximum group size of the event will be 4 and the minimum is 2, and it’s open for other college students as well. Students will be required to prepare a PPT and to submit their ideas. After reviewing the softcopies, the shortlisted candidates will have to explain their ideas in a time duration of 3-5 mins. Accordingly, the first two winners will receive the prizes.
platform: Slides submission through Google Form, Review will be taken on Google Meet
rules: No. of rounds: 2
No. of hours and days required: 3-4 days
Slides submission through Google Form, Review will be taken on Google Meet
Only SE computer students and other colleges of SE computer students
Maximum group length is 4 students
Project ideas expressed through softcopy like PPT, PDF
Project idea time duration: 5-10 min for each group
Fees for each group is Rs. 100
All the registered groups will have to submit their softcopies, then the shortlisted groups will have to give presentation in front of the judges.

Judging Criteria :     1) Confidence and way of explaining points 2) Idea feasibility and scope 3) Uniqueness of idea 4) Overall content of PPT ( Theme used for designing the PPT, decoration, short and crisp content of the idea )
(You will be playing for Yourself, and the prizes will be sent to you alone, no need to share your prize anymore)

Format of the PPTs: Slide-1: College name and logo, department name, Project Title, Students name with Roll No.  Slide-2: Motivation of Project Slide-3: Objectives of Project Slide-4: Idea Description ( Can add images and citations if needed ) Slide-5 : Thank you
